meanings.definition: To fold up or bend upwards.
meanings.sent1: She upfolded the letter before putting it in the envelope.
meanings.sent2: He always upfolded the map carefully after using it.
meanings.sent3: The cat upfolded its ears in surprise when it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The flower upfolded its petals as the sun rose in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The magician upfolded the cloth to reveal a hidden object underneath.

meanings.sent1: The upfolded corner of the page caught her attention.
meanings.sent2: The upfolded umbrella was left by the door.
meanings.sent3: The upfolded napkin looked like a tiny mountain on the table.
meanings.sent4: The upfolded edge of the carpet revealed a hidden treasure underneath.
meanings.sent5: The upfolded flag fluttered proudly in the wind.
